medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant and epigastric pain for 4 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed stabbing, constant pain in the right upper quadrant and epigastric area that has lasted for 4 days. The pain is radiating to the back, associated with nausea but without vomiting, fever, or chills. The patient also noted lighter stool color on the day of admission and described general pruritis over the past 4 days.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension (HTN), hyperthyroidism status post ablation, clear cell renal cell carcinoma. Recent laparoscopic left radical nephrectomy and adrenalectomy, and laparoscopic right adrenalectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Breast cancer runs in the family; negative for kidney cancer.
